informal.title: Reacting to News
informal.question: Your friend [Name] has told you they got accepted into [university/job]. Write an email reacting to the news, asking questions, and suggesting a way to celebrate.

styles.default:
Hi [Name],

That’s amazing news! I’m so happy for you — I knew you’d get into [university/job]! You’ve worked so hard for this.

So tell me everything! When do you start, and have you found out what your schedule will be like? Do you already know where you’ll be living?

We should celebrate properly. How about going out for [pizza/coffee] this weekend? If you’re free on [day], we could meet at [place] around [time].

Congrats again — I’m genuinely proud of you!

Lots of love,
[Your Name]
styles.alternative1:
Hey [Name]!

No way — that’s fantastic! I’m honestly thrilled for you. Getting into [university/job] is a huge achievement.

What happens next? Do you have to do any paperwork or interviews? And how did you find out — were you nervous opening the message?

Let’s celebrate — maybe [activity] on [day]. My treat!

Talk soon,
[Your Name]
styles.alternative2:
Hi [Name],

Congratulations! I’m so happy you got accepted into [university/job].

When do you start? Let’s celebrate soon.

[Your Name]

informal.title: Invitation
informal.question: Invite your friend to visit your town for the weekend. Suggest activities, make arrangements, and offer help.

styles.default:
Hey [Name],

Would you like to come and visit [your town] next month? It would be so nice to see you, and there’s loads we could do.

If you come on [Friday], we could explore [place] and have dinner somewhere cosy. On Saturday, we could go to [activity] and finish the day with [another activity].

Don’t worry about transport — I can pick you up from [station]. And you can stay at my place if you like.

Let me know what dates work for you and I’ll plan everything!

See you soon,
[Your Name]
styles.alternative1:
Hi [Name],

I was thinking — you should totally come to [your town] for a weekend! How about [date range]?

We could do a bit of everything: a walk around [area], lunch at [café], and maybe [museum/beach] if the weather is good. If you’re up for it, we can also do [evening plan].

I can sort out the practical stuff — pick you up, help with tickets, whatever you need.

Tell me if you’re free!

Hugs,
[Your Name]
styles.alternative2:
Hey [Name],

Do you want to visit [your town] soon? You can stay with me, and I can pick you up.

Let me know the dates!

[Your Name]

informal.title: Apology
informal.question: You have to cancel plans with a friend at the last minute. Write an email apologising, explaining briefly, and suggesting an alternative.

styles.default:
Hi [Name],

I’m really sorry, but I have to cancel our plans for [day]. I feel awful about it because I was genuinely looking forward to seeing you.

The reason is that [brief reason], and I can’t avoid it.

Could we do it another day instead? I’m free on [alt day 1] or [alt day 2]. If you want, coffee is on me.

Sorry again. Let me know what works.

[Your Name]
styles.alternative1:
Hey [Name],

I hate doing this, but I need to cancel [plan]. Something came up and I can’t move it.

I’m really disappointed because I was excited to catch up. How about we reschedule for [new day]?

Sorry — I owe you one!

[Your Name]
styles.alternative2:
Hi [Name],

Sorry, I can’t meet on [day]. Can we do [new day] instead?

[Your Name]

informal.title: Giving Advice
informal.question: Your friend is stressed about [exams/work]. Write an email giving advice, making suggestions, and encouraging them.

styles.default:
Hey [Name],

I’m sorry you’re feeling so stressed about [exams/work]. From my point of view, the main thing is not to try to fix everything at once.

If I were you, I’d make a simple plan for the week and break tasks into small steps. It might be a good idea to work in short sessions and take proper breaks. Don’t underestimate sleep — it really helps.

You’ve got this. If you want, we can talk later and I can help you with [topic].

[Your Name]
styles.alternative1:
Hi [Name],

I hate hearing you’re under so much pressure. It seems to me you’re trying to do too much at the same time.

You should prioritise the essentials first, then do one task at a time. Why don’t you work somewhere calm, leave your phone away, and reward yourself after each task?

Don’t forget you’re not alone — I’m here.

[Your Name]
styles.alternative2:
Hey [Name],

Sorry you’re stressed. Make a plan and do one thing at a time.

You can do it — message me if you need help.

[Your Name]

informal.title: Refusing Politely
informal.question: A friend invited you to [event/trip], but you can’t go. Write an email refusing politely, explaining why, and suggesting an alternative plan.

styles.default:
Hi [Name],

Thanks so much for inviting me to [event/trip] — it sounds brilliant. But I’m afraid I can’t because [brief reason].

I’m genuinely disappointed, especially because it would have been so much fun. How about we plan something soon, like [coffee/movie/walk]? I’m free on [day].

Have an amazing time — and send photos!

[Your Name]
styles.alternative1:
Hey [Name],

Your invite made my day — it sounds so fun. Sadly, I won’t be able to make it because [reason].

Could we do something else instead? Maybe [alternative] next week? I’d love to catch up properly.

Hope it’s amazing!

[Your Name]
styles.alternative2:
Hi [Name],

Thanks for inviting me, but I can’t go because [reason].

Can we meet another time?

[Your Name]
